	Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
	Ability to work independently and under minimal supervision
	Physical stamina and attention to detail


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Mechanical and electrical troubleshooting
	Time management and multitasking
	Teamwork and communication skills
	Customer service orientation
	Compliance with safety standards


Method of Application&nbsp;

Auto Technician Job at Mikano International




        
    

        
        Mikano International is Nigerian company in the power generation, automobile, steel fabrication sectors. This company offers sales, maintenance, assembly and distribution of power generation products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Auto Technician

Job Location: Wawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview:
     

            
    




	An experienced person who would be responsible for inspecting, diagnosing, repairing, and maintaining company's Trucks / Vehicle to ensure optimal performance, safety, and reliability.
	The role involves handling mechanical and electrical faults in line with manufacturer and company standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspect vehicles to identify mechanical, electrical, and electronic faults
	Diagnose problems using diagnostic tools and technical manuals
	Perform routine vehicle servicing and preventive maintenance
	Repair or replace defective parts such as engines, brakes, suspension, and transmission systems
	Carry out wheel alignment, balancing, and brake servicing
	Ensure vehicles meet safety and roadworthiness standards
	Test-drive vehicles before and after repairs to ensure issues are resolved
	Maintain accurate service and repair records
	Follow safety procedures and workshop best practices
	Keep tools, equipment, and work areas clean and well maintained
	Provide technical advice and recommendations to supervisors or customers


Qualifications & Requirements


	Minimum of OND, Trade Test Certificate, or equivalent in Automobile Engineering or a related field
	Proven experience as an Auto Technician or Mechanic
	Strong knowledge of vehicle systems (petrol and diesel engines)
	Ability to use diagnostic equipment and hand tools
	Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
	Ability to work independently and under minimal supervision
	Physical stamina and attention to detail


Skills & Competencies:


	Mechanical and electrical troubleshooting
	Time management and multitasking
	Teamwork and communication skills
	Customer service orientation
	Compliance with safety standards


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CVs to: careers@mikano-intl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Internal Auditor",
  "description": "Nepal Energies Limited is a Nigerian owned, down, mid and up-stream oil and gas company; created to provide indigenous solutions to the energy and unemployment problems in Nigeria, using standard practices. Since our inception on 13th of October 2004, Nepal have navigated the business of trading, supply and production support in the down and mid-sub-sectors of the petroleum industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute risk-based internal audit plans covering operational, financial, and compliance areas.
	Conduct audits of depots, retail outlets, trading, logistics, and finance operations to ensure adherence to internal controls.
	Review and test internal control systems to assess their adequacy, effectiveness, and reliability.
	Identify control and process weaknesses and recommend practical risk mitigation solutions.
	Assess and report on key risk exposures, including product losses, inventory management, supply chain operations, and revenue assurance.
	Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and internal policies (e.g., NMDPRA/DPR, tax, and environmental requirements).
	Prepare clear and concise audit reports highlighting findings, implications, and actionable recommendations.
	Present audit results to management and follow up on the implementation of corrective actions.
	Conduct periodic reviews of financial records, reconciliations, and asset management processes.
	Evaluate internal controls over petroleum product movement, storage, and sales transactions.
